<!channel> 
Last call for notes on Droga5's design deck. Need to let him know this morning that all our notes are in the doc:
<https://docs.google.com/a/droga5.com/presentation/d/1cl7sepgzUmBTelELmUnmZ4ZNfy_Z_GmnlUKW-ZCfUhM/edit?usp=sharing>
can you add me to the deck?
The only potential issue I see is in the screens that scroll behind the status bar

I just added a comment to slide 10 to answer <@U0260V1BX>'s question... showing/hiding the app bar is easy to do, I'm just concerned that it might feel awkward to the user if the show/hide animation timing doesn't perfectly match the crosswalk webview scrolling behavior. (much like how scrolling felt awkward and sluggish on the tizen watch with immersion)
right. that makes sense... so my question is really... can we make the app bar native and have the web view below it?
so that the app bar stays put, and the webview can scroll
that is the current behavior with the demo code I have started on (app bar is always up there)
not ideal in terms of having the experience be immersive, but potantially better than a weird lag in timing
and it may turn out that we can show/hide the app bar and it behaves perfectly, I just wanted to raise the concern early since I've seen similar issues
actually, maybe a good approach would be to expose JS hooks for showing/hiding the app bar, so it can be controlled from within the webview
